    • Constructor Detail

      • Options.Flag

        public Options.Flag(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String params,
            java.lang.String usage)
        Parameters:
        id - The flag ID. e.g., "--name", "-n", or "-name".
        params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
        usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."

      • Options.Flag

        public Options.Flag(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String params,
            java.lang.String usage,
            int defaultValue)
        Parameters:
        id - The flag ID. e.g., "--name", "-n", or "-name".
        params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
        usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."
        defaultValue - The default value for the flag parameter, to be printed out with help info.

      • Options.Flag

        public Options.Flag(java.lang.String[] ids,
            java.lang.String params,
            java.lang.String usage)
        Parameters:
        ids - Flag IDs. e.g., { "--name", "-n", "-name"}. The first one specified will be the one printed out with help info.
        params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
        usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public abstract int handle(java.lang.String[] args,
         int index)
                    throws UsageError
        Handles a usage flag.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments from the command line.
        index - The index of the argument following the usage flag.
        Returns:
        The next index to be processed. e.g., if calling this method processes two arguments, then the return value should be index+2.
        Throws:
        UsageError - If an error occurs while handling the usage flag.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Options.Flag other)

        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Options.Flag>
